newsitem.title: USA: Calif. labor changes to take effect in 1998 - panel.
newsitem.headline: Calif. labor changes to take effect in 1998 - panel.

text.p: California's new employee overtime rules will go into effect on January 1, 1998, the state Industrial Welfare Commission said on Friday.
Last week, the commission voted 3-2 to change the state's employee overtime policy from an eight-hour workday standard to a 40-hour workweek standard.
The commission could have imposed the new rules on July 1, but decided to give private-sector employers more time to adjust to the changes, the state panel said in a statement.
Under the new rules adopted by the commission, many private-sector workers would only be eligible for overtime once they have worked at least 40 hours in a week.
Under the old rule, a worker became eligible for overtime on a daily basis after putting in eight hours.
Until the new rules take effect next January, the current regulations will remain in force.
Several lawsuits have already been filed to block the changes.
